get.description: Get all issues the authenticated user has access to. By default it returns only issues created by the current user. To get all issues, use parameter scope=all.
Get a list of a group’s issues.
Get a list of a project’s issues.
Only for administrators. Get a single issue.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the issue

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

parameters.name: issue_iid
parameters.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

parameters.name: assignee_id
parameters.description: The ID of the user to assign the issue to. Only appears on GitLab Free.

parameters.name: assignee_ids
parameters.description: The IDs of the users to assign the issue to.

parameters.name: confidential
parameters.description: Set an issue to be confidential. Default is false.

parameters.name: created_at
parameters.description: When the issue was created. Date time string, ISO 8601 formatted, for example 2016-03-11T03:45:40Z. Requires administrator or project/group owner rights.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description of an issue. Limited to 1,048,576 characters.

parameters.name: discussion_to_resolve
parameters.description: The ID of a discussion to resolve. This fills out the issue with a default description and mark the discussion as resolved. Use in combination with merge_request_to_resolve_discussions_of.

parameters.name: due_date
parameters.description: The due date. Date time string in the format YYYY-MM-DD, for example 2016-03-11

parameters.name: epic_id
parameters.description: ID of the epic to add the issue to. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0.

parameters.name: epic_iid
parameters.description: IID of the epic to add the issue to. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0. (deprecated, scheduled for removal in API version 5)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

parameters.name: iid
parameters.description: The internal ID of the project’s issue (requires administrator or project owner rights)

parameters.name: issue_type
parameters.description: The type of issue. One of issue, incident, or test_case. Default is issue.

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: Comma-separated label names for an issue

parameters.name: merge_request_to_resolve_discussions_of
parameters.description: The IID of a merge request in which to resolve all issues. This fills out the issue with a default description and mark all discussions as resolved. When passing a description or title, these values take precedence over the default values.

parameters.name: milestone_id
parameters.description: The global ID of a milestone to assign issue. To find the milestone_id associated with a milestone, view an issue with the milestone assigned and use the API to retrieve the issue’s details.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of an issue

parameters.name: weight
parameters.description: The weight of the issue. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0.

put.description: Updates an existing project issue. This call is also used to mark an issue as closed.

parameters.name: add_labels
parameters.description: Comma-separated label names to add to an issue.

parameters.name: assignee_ids
parameters.description: The ID of the user(s) to assign the issue to. Set to 0 or provide an empty value to unassign all assignees.

parameters.name: confidential
parameters.description: Updates an issue to be confidential

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description of an issue. Limited to 1,048,576 characters.

parameters.name: discussion_locked
parameters.description: Flag indicating if the issue’s discussion is locked. If the discussion is locked only project members can add or edit comments.

parameters.name: due_date
parameters.description: The due date. Date time string in the format YYYY-MM-DD, for example 2016-03-11

parameters.name: epic_id
parameters.description: ID of the epic to add the issue to. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0.

parameters.name: epic_iid
parameters.description: IID of the epic to add the issue to. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0. (deprecated, scheduled for removal in API version 5)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

parameters.name: issue_iid
parameters.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

parameters.name: issue_type
parameters.description: Updates the type of issue. One of issue, incident, or test_case.

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: Comma-separated label names for an issue. Set to an empty string to unassign all labels.

parameters.name: milestone_id
parameters.description: The global ID of a milestone to assign the issue to. Set to 0 or provide an empty value to unassign a milestone.

parameters.name: remove_labels
parameters.description: Comma-separated label names to remove from an issue.

parameters.name: state_event
parameters.description: The state event of an issue. Set close to close the issue and reopen to reopen it

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of an issue

parameters.name: updated_at
parameters.description: When the issue was updated. Date time string, ISO 8601 formatted, for example 2016-03-11T03:45:40Z (requires administrator or project owner rights). Empty string or null values are not accepted.

parameters.name: weight
parameters.description: The weight of the issue. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0. 0

delete.description: Only for administrators and project owners. Deletes an issue.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

parameters.name: issue_iid
parameters.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

put.description: Reorders an issue, you can see the results when sorting issues manually

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

parameters.name: issue_iid
parameters.description: The internal ID of the project’s issue

parameters.name: move_after_id
parameters.description: The ID of a project’s issue that should be placed after this issue

parameters.name: move_before_id
parameters.description: The ID of a project’s issue that should be placed before this issue

post.description: Moves an issue to a different project. If the target project is the source project or the user has insufficient permissions, an error message with status code 400 is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

parameters.name: issue_iid
parameters.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

parameters.name: to_project_id
parameters.description: The ID of the new project

post.description: Clone the issue to given project. If the user has insufficient permissions, an error message with status code 400 is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user.

parameters.name: issue_iid
parameters.description: Internal ID of a project’s issue.

parameters.name: to_project_id
parameters.description: ID of the new project.

parameters.name: with_notes
parameters.description: Clone the issue with notes. Default is false.

post.description: Subscribes the authenticated user to an issue to receive notifications. If the user is already subscribed to the issue, the status code 304 is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

parameters.name: issue_iid
parameters.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

post.description: Unsubscribes the authenticated user from the issue to not receive notifications from it. If the user is not subscribed to the issue, the status code 304 is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

parameters.name: issue_iid
parameters.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

post.description: Manually creates a to-do item for the current user on an issue. If there already exists a to-do item for the user on that issue, status code 304 is returned.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

parameters.name: issue_iid
parameters.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

post.summary: Promote an issue to an epic
post.description: Promotes an issue to an epic by adding a comment with the /promote quick action.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

parameters.name: issue_iid
parameters.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The content of a note. Must contain /promote at the start of a new line.

post.summary: Set a time estimate for an issue
post.description: Sets an estimated time of work for this issue.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The duration in human format. e.g: 3h30m

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

parameters.name: issue_iid
parameters.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

post.summary: Reset the time estimate for an issue
post.description: Resets the estimated time for this issue to 0 seconds.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

parameters.name: issue_iid
parameters.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

post.summary: Add spent time for an issue
post.description: Adds spent time for this issue

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The duration in human format. e.g: 3h30m

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

parameters.name: issue_iid
parameters.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

parameters.name: summary
parameters.description: A summary of how the time was spent

post.summary: Reset spent time for an issue
post.description: Resets the total spent time for this issue to 0 seconds.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

parameters.name: issue_iid
parameters.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

get.description: If the project is private or the issue is confidential, you need to provide credentials to authorize. The preferred way to do this, is by using personal access tokens.

parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

parameters.name: issue_iid
parameters.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

get.summary: List merge requests related to issue
get.description: Get all the merge requests that are related to the issue.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID or URL-encoded path of the project owned by the authenticated user

parameters.name: issue_iid
parameters.description: The internal ID of a project’s issue

get.summary: List merge requests that close a particular issue on merge
get.description: Get all merge requests that close a particular issue when merged.

parameters.name: issue_iid
parameters.description: The internal ID of a project issue
